main_definition: Ver is a German word that can be translated to 'true' or related to truth in English, but it also serves as an informal verb used in some idioms.

meanings_and_examples.example: When asked if the news was true, he simply said 'ver' to affirm its truth.
I had to ver all the information before submitting it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial term used in some German idioms, similar to saying 'yeah' or 'right', with a connotation of agreement or affirmation.
meanings_and_examples.example: When I told him the plan was feasible, he responded with 'ver!'
